metadata.title: CVE-2015-5237 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: protobuf allows remote authenticated attackers to cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

notes.note: seth-arnold> No fix as of 2015-08-27, since the message parsing limit defaults to 64 megabytes a software author would have to change the limit in order to handle larger messages anyway, and is thus unlikely to generate these messages in the short-term. (There is no actual limit on generation, so this might be an issue today -- it is just not a priority for the maintainer.)

criterions.comment: protobuf package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2015-08-27').
